original: @108b * // sgrol ma'i man ngag me long dangs pa zhes bya ba bzhugs /🔽# // rje btsun sgrol ma thugs rje sgrol //
analyzed: @108b * // sgrol ma'i man ngag me long dangs pa zhes bya ba bzhugs / # // rje btsun sgrol ma thugs rje sgrol //
translated: The Mirror of Clear Crystal: Instructions on Tārā🔽Homage to the compassionate Tārā,

original: dngos grub sgrol ma gus btud de //
analyzed: dngos grub sgrol ma gus btud de //
translated: the Tārā who grants spiritual powers.

original: phyag 'tshal skyabs 'gro byin gyis rlobs //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyabs 'gro byin gyis rlobs //
translated: I bow down, go for refuge, and request your blessings.

original: bla ma rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bla ma rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the gurus.

original: rje btsun sgrol ma dngos grub bla na med pa'i gsang ba ltar bsgrub pa'i sgrub thabs kyi man ngag me tog gi phreng ba lta bu ni /🔽'dir chos 'di la mos shing gus pas skye ba 'di nyid la sgrol ma'i go 'phang thob par 'dod @109a * //
analyzed: rje btsun sgrol ma dngos grub bla na med pa'i gsang ba ltar bsgrub pa'i sgrub thabs kyi man ngag me tog gi phreng ba lta bu ni / 'dir chos 'di la mos shing gus pas skye ba 'di nyid la sgrol ma'i go 'phang thob par 'dod @109a * //
translated: The garland-like instructions on the means of accomplishment of the practice of the secret of the unsurpassed spiritual powers of Venerable Tārā is as follows.

original: pas ; rgyu bzhi ste 'khor ba la gshed mar mthong ba dang / zas nor la dug tu mthong ba dang / 'khor ba'i las 'bras bu ngan song gsum du mthong ba dang / byas pa don med cing 'bral zhing mi rtag par shes pa dang /
analyzed: pas ; rgyu bzhi ste 'khor ba la gshed mar mthong ba dang / zas nor la dug tu mthong ba dang / 'khor ba'i las 'bras bu ngan song gsum du mthong ba dang / byas pa don med cing 'bral zhing mi rtag par shes pa dang /
translated: Here, those who aspire to and have faith in this teaching and who wish to attain the state of Tārā in this very lifetime should have four causes: seeing saṃsāra as a butcher, seeing food and wealth as poison, seeing the results of actions in saṃsāra as the three lower realms, and understanding that what is done is meaningless, will be separated from you, and is impermanent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dod pa tshad pas gdungs pa chu 'dod pa lta bu brtson 'grus can de las 'byung gi / gzhan lam yin pas kun la spel zhing rang gi dam tshig nyams shing dngos grub ring la don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dod pa tshad pas gdungs pa chu 'dod pa lta bu brtson 'grus can de las 'byung gi / gzhan lam yin pas kun la spel zhing rang gi dam tshig nyams shing dngos grub ring la don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is diligent in the desire for the qualities of Buddhahood, like one tormented by heat who desires water, will emerge from that, but the other one, because of being on the path, will spread it to everyone, and his own commitments will be damaged, and he will be far from powers and will be without purpose.

original: de yang sdom pa gsum gyi lung sgrub thabs ji lta ba bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: de yang sdom pa gsum gyi lung sgrub thabs ji lta ba bzhin du byas la /
translated: Moreover, having performed the scriptures of the three vows and the means of achievement just as they are,

original: lam du blangs nas sangs rgyas sgrol ma thob par 'dod pa la don gsum ste /
analyzed: lam du blangs nas sangs rgyas sgrol ma thob par 'dod pa la don gsum ste /
translated: having taken them as the path, there are three topics for the one who desires to attain the Buddha's liberation.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa thun mong ma yin pa'i tshogs lam dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa thun mong ma yin pa ye shes kyi lam dang / gzhan ma dad pa bzlog pa las tshogs yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang gsum mo //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa thun mong ma yin pa'i tshogs lam dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa thun mong ma yin pa ye shes kyi lam dang / gzhan ma dad pa bzlog pa las tshogs yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang gsum mo //
translated: The uncommon path of accumulation of the uncommon creation stage, the uncommon path of wisdom of the completion stage, and the wish-granting jewel of the accumulation of the reversal of the faithlessness of others.

original: sgrub thabs bzhin bskyed rim rdzogs nas rang gi thugs ka'i nyi zla'i steng du t'am ljang sngon mtha' mar dpa' mo 'bru lnga'i 'od zer kha dog lnga'i 'od kyi 'ja' tshon ltar bsams nas sngags bzlas te /
analyzed: sgrub thabs bzhin bskyed rim rdzogs nas rang gi thugs ka'i nyi zla'i steng du t'am ljang sngon mtha' mar dpa' mo 'bru lnga'i 'od zer kha dog lnga'i 'od kyi 'ja' tshon ltar bsams nas sngags bzlas te /
translated: After completing the creation stage according to the sādhana, imagine a blue tāṃ on the sun and moon above one’s heart, surrounded by the five seed syllables of the heroines, and the five-colored light rays of the syllables like a rainbow.

original: dmigs pa de la gtad pas 'od 'phros te /
analyzed: dmigs pa de la gtad pas 'od 'phros te /
translated: As one recites the mantra, focus on that visualization.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i rgyud sbyangs pa dang / rang gi dug lnga sbyangs bsregs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i rgyud sbyangs pa dang / rang gi dug lnga sbyangs bsregs te /
translated: Light radiates and purifies the continuums of the five types of migrating beings, purifying and burning one’s own five poisons.

original: 'gro ba drug gi sa bon ye shes lnga'i 'od kyis bsregs pas sems can gyi don tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi sa bon ye shes lnga'i 'od kyis bsregs pas sems can gyi don tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The seeds of the six realms are burned by the light of the five awarenesses, which is not different from the benefit of sentient beings.

original: slar 'dus pa las /
analyzed: slar 'dus pa las /
translated: Again, light radiates🔽and one’s five aggregates become Vajra Tārā, Cakra Tārā, Ratna Tārā, Padma Tārā, and Karma Tārā.

original: rang gi phung po lnga rdo rje sgrol ma dang / 'khor lo sgrol ma dang / rin chen sgrol ma dang / padma sgrol ma dang / las kyi sgrol mar gyur pa dang / snang la rang bzhin med pa dang / gsal la 'dzin pa med pa bsgom /
analyzed: rang gi phung po lnga rdo rje sgrol ma dang / 'khor lo sgrol ma dang / rin chen sgrol ma dang / padma sgrol ma dang / las kyi sgrol mar gyur pa dang / snang la rang bzhin med pa dang / gsal la 'dzin pa med pa bsgom /
translated: Meditate on them appearing without intrinsic nature and clearly without grasping.

original: thun bzhi'i sbyor bas bya'o //
analyzed: thun bzhi'i sbyor bas bya'o //
translated: This should be done in four sessions.

original: de'i grogs gtor ma dang / mchod pa dang / bskor ba dang / mandala dang / bstod pa dang / gzungs dang s'atstsha gdab pa la sogs pas bskangs te /🔽bskyed rim nang du bslang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i grogs gtor ma dang / mchod pa dang / bskor ba dang / mandala dang / bstod pa dang / gzungs dang s'atstsha gdab pa la sogs pas bskangs te / bskyed rim nang du bslang ba'o //
translated: The support for this is the torma, offerings, circumambulation, maṇḍala, praise, dhāraṇī, scattering flowers, and so on.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa la don bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa la don bzhi ste /
translated: The completion stage has four topics:

original: sna tshogs lam khyer dang / nyi ma lam khyer dang / nam mkha' lam khyer ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs lam khyer dang / nyi ma lam khyer dang / nam mkha' lam khyer ro //
translated: integrating the variety, integrating the sun, and integrating space.

original: sna tshogs ni rgya che ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs ni rgya che ste /
translated: The variety is vast.

original: skar ma ltar snang ba sna tshogs 'di /
analyzed: skar ma ltar snang ba sna tshogs 'di /
translated: The various appearances, like stars,

original: gzung ba'i yul chags sdang gnyis la brten @109b nas ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul chags sdang gnyis la brten @109b nas ;
translated: are based on the two, attachment and aversion, which are the objects to be grasped.

original: ngan song gi sdug bsngal myong bar byed pas /
analyzed: ngan song gi sdug bsngal myong bar byed pas /
translated: Since they cause one to experience the suffering of the lower realms,

original: de zil gyis mnan pa ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de zil gyis mnan pa ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya'o //
translated: overpowering them is understanding all phenomena to be like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyang rmi lam lta bur shes par bya /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyang rmi lam lta bur shes par bya /
translated: Even the phenomena of nirvāṇa should be understood to be like a dream.

original: de las ches lhag pa'i chos gcig yod na'ang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bur shes par bya'o /
analyzed: de las ches lhag pa'i chos gcig yod na'ang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bur shes par bya'o /
translated: If there is a phenomenon greater than that, it should be understood to be like an illusion and like a dream.

original: dngos por rang brgyud pa'i zhen pa log ste /
analyzed: dngos por rang brgyud pa'i zhen pa log ste /
translated: One turns away from the clinging to things as having an independent nature.🔽

original: sgyu mar shes pas gzung bas stong zhing 'dzin pas dben pa thabs lha'i rnal 'byor dang / shes rab stong pa de rgyu stong pa dbyer med pa lam yin par rgyal ba'i bka' las gsungs so //🔽de bas na lha'i lus sgyu ma lta bu dang / ngag sngags 'brug sgra lta bu dang / sems ting nge 'dzin gsal ba nam mkha'i ngo bor 'das pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu mar shes pas gzung bas stong zhing 'dzin pas dben pa thabs lha'i rnal 'byor dang / shes rab stong pa de rgyu stong pa dbyer med pa lam yin par rgyal ba'i bka' las gsungs so // de bas na lha'i lus sgyu ma lta bu dang / ngag sngags 'brug sgra lta bu dang / sems ting nge 'dzin gsal ba nam mkha'i ngo bor 'das pa ni /
translated: The Buddha's word teaches that the path is the inseparability of the method, the deity yoga that is empty of the apprehended and devoid of the apprehender through the understanding of illusion, and the wisdom, emptiness, the empty cause.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i lam dang po'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i lam dang po'o //
translated: Therefore, the illusory body of the deity, the speech that is the sound of the mantra like thunder, and the mind that is the clarity of concentration that transcends the nature of space is the first stage of the completion stage.

original: lam gnyis pa nyi ma ni /
analyzed: lam gnyis pa nyi ma ni /
translated: The second stage is the sun.

original: lus kyi sgrol ma bsgom ste /
analyzed: lus kyi sgrol ma bsgom ste /
translated: Meditate on the body as the body of Tārā.

original: 'byung ba rim par brtsegs la sgo phyi ma gnyis bcad la /🔽bdag po nang du bsdad la khang pa dbus mar me sgron btang la gdugs kyi 'od phab la /
analyzed: 'byung ba rim par brtsegs la sgo phyi ma gnyis bcad la / bdag po nang du bsdad la khang pa dbus mar me sgron btang la gdugs kyi 'od phab la /
translated: The elements are stacked one upon another, and the two outer doors are closed.🔽The lord remains inside, and a butter lamp is lit in the central room.

original: lam po che nas 'thon te /
analyzed: lam po che nas 'thon te /
translated: The light of the parasol is brought down, and one emerges from the main road.

original: yul bzhi ru gnas la /
analyzed: yul bzhi ru gnas la /
translated: One remains in the four countries.

original: phyi rol thams cad la mi sprad par byas te /
analyzed: phyi rol thams cad la mi sprad par byas te /
translated: One does not give anything to anyone outside.

original: mar me rlung gis bskyod par byas la /
analyzed: mar me rlung gis bskyod par byas la /
translated: Having made a lamp flicker in the wind,

original: rang gi dgos pa nor bu rin po che de la rkun mas mi khyer ba'i me la tsho la brtson par byas na dbul phongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi dgos pa nor bu rin po che de la rkun mas mi khyer ba'i me la tsho la brtson par byas na dbul phongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one should strive to protect the precious gem of one’s purpose from being carried away by thieves. One will not become poor.

original: gsum pa thabs khyad par can gyi lam gyis sangs rgyas myur du thob par bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum pa thabs khyad par can gyi lam gyis sangs rgyas myur du thob par bya ba ni /
translated: The Swift Attainment of Buddhahood through the Path of Special Means

original: mi'i bu mo shes rab sgrol ma bsten la bya ste /
analyzed: mi'i bu mo shes rab sgrol ma bsten la bya ste /
translated: One should rely on the human maiden Prajñālokā.🔽For the middling one, who conquers thoughts, one should rely on a maiden with the right qualifications, who is endowed with samaya, and who is a suitable messenger with flexible organs.

original: dbang po 'bring po rtog pa zil gyis mnan pa ni tshad dang ldan pa'i bu mo dang / dam tshig tu ldan pa gsang spyod kyi rten dang / b'a yu las su rung ba'i pho nyas steng 'og las thams cad bya ste /🔽kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems skye chu bzhin phab nas /
analyzed: dbang po 'bring po rtog pa zil gyis mnan pa ni tshad dang ldan pa'i bu mo dang / dam tshig tu ldan pa gsang spyod kyi rten dang / b'a yu las su rung ba'i pho nyas steng 'og las thams cad bya ste / kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems skye chu bzhin phab nas /
translated: One should perform all the rites of the upper and lower doors.🔽Having caused the relative bodhicitta to fall like rain,

original: don dam dang gnyis su med pa'i sems rdzing bzhin du bskyil la /
analyzed: don dam dang gnyis su med pa'i sems rdzing bzhin du bskyil la /
translated: one should retain the ultimate bodhicitta, which is nondual, like a lake.

original: phyi nang gzung 'dzin sna tshogs thams cad skad cig ma ye shes kyi 'od du bsdus nas bde ba chen por bsgom /
analyzed: phyi nang gzung 'dzin sna tshogs thams cad skad cig ma ye shes kyi 'od du bsdus nas bde ba chen por bsgom /
translated: Meditate on great bliss by gathering all the various outer and inner percepts and perceivers into the light of the instant wisdom.

original: sgo lnga yul thams cad bzhir bsdus la de yang gcig gi ngo bor gsal ba thun dang thun mtshams su bcad la bsgom mo //
analyzed: sgo lnga yul thams cad bzhir bsdus la de yang gcig gi ngo bor gsal ba thun dang thun mtshams su bcad la bsgom mo //
translated: Gather all the objects of the five senses into four, and meditate on that as the essence of one.

original: dbang po rab kyi dbang du byas na nam mkha' lam khyer bsgom par bya ste /🔽rten @110a * //
analyzed: dbang po rab kyi dbang du byas na nam mkha' lam khyer bsgom par bya ste / rten @110a * //
translated: For those of the highest capacity, meditate on integrating space into the path.

original: med lam du 'jug pa ni nam mkha' rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: med lam du 'jug pa ni nam mkha' rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The path of entering without support is the three types of space:

original: nang gi nam mkha' dang / phyi'i nam mkha' dang / bar snang gi nam mkha'o //
analyzed: nang gi nam mkha' dang / phyi'i nam mkha' dang / bar snang gi nam mkha'o //
translated: inner space, outer space, and space of the sky.

original: nang gi nam mkha' la gnyis te /
analyzed: nang gi nam mkha' la gnyis te /
translated: Inner space is twofold:

original: shes par bya ba la gsum dang / gzhag par bya ba la gsum mo //
analyzed: shes par bya ba la gsum dang / gzhag par bya ba la gsum mo //
translated: the three for understanding and the three for resting.

original: shes par bya ba gsum ni /
analyzed: shes par bya ba gsum ni /
translated: The three for understanding are as follows:

original: phyi nang bcud kyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad rang gi sems su shes par bya ba dang / sems nyid spros pa nye bar zhi ba dang / de bde chen zung 'jug 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nang bcud kyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad rang gi sems su shes par bya ba dang / sems nyid spros pa nye bar zhi ba dang / de bde chen zung 'jug 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: and that is the clear light of the union of great bliss.

original: gzhag par bya ba gsum ni /
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba gsum ni /
translated: There are three things to be placed:

original: nang zab mo'i gtan tshigs gsum ste /
analyzed: nang zab mo'i gtan tshigs gsum ste /
translated: the three profound inner reasons.

original: bla ma dam pa'i gad mas ngag gis thog ma bar gsum dbyibs dang kha dog ngos bzung rten brtsam pa la sogs pa dang / zab mo dbang gi dus dang / snang stong dbyer med kyi mtshams ni gnyug ma'i sgrol ma ste /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i gad mas ngag gis thog ma bar gsum dbyibs dang kha dog ngos bzung rten brtsam pa la sogs pa dang / zab mo dbang gi dus dang / snang stong dbyer med kyi mtshams ni gnyug ma'i sgrol ma ste /
translated: The beginning, middle, and end of the speech of the excellent guru are the shape and color, the support, the creation, and so on, the time of the profound empowerment, and the inseparability of appearance and emptiness, which is the natural Tārā.

original: 'khor ba las sgrol ba'i sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las sgrol ba'i sgrol ma'o //
translated: She is the Tārā who liberates from samsara.

original: phyi'i nam mkha' la bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyi'i nam mkha' la bzhi ste /
translated: There are four things in outer space:

original: dpe don la bsre ba dang / don dpe la bstim pa dang / de gnyis dbyer med du gnas la gnas pa dang / nyid gsum gcig tu go bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe don la bsre ba dang / don dpe la bstim pa dang / de gnyis dbyer med du gnas la gnas pa dang / nyid gsum gcig tu go bar bya ba'o //
translated: mixing the example with the meaning, dissolving the meaning into the example, the indivisibility of those two, and understanding the three of those as one.

original: bar snang gi nam mkha' la drug ste /
analyzed: bar snang gi nam mkha' la drug ste /
translated: There are six things in the space of the sky:

original: bems po'i sna rtse dang / 'od kyi sna rtse dang / dran pa'i sna rtse dang / dus kyi sna rtse dang ; dbyibs kyi sna rtse dang / myong ba'i sna rtse dang / thun du bcad la bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bems po'i sna rtse dang / 'od kyi sna rtse dang / dran pa'i sna rtse dang / dus kyi sna rtse dang ; dbyibs kyi sna rtse dang / myong ba'i sna rtse dang / thun du bcad la bsgom pa'o //
translated: The tip of the material, the tip of the light, the tip of the memory, the tip of the time, the tip of the shape, the tip of the experience, and the meditation in the divided sessions.

original: de dag la 'bad pas bskyed pa'i rim pa brtan zhing zhal mthong ba dang / snang rtags thams cad sgyu mar myong ba dang / ngo bo ma skyes pa'i chos la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas mthong ba dag nas sa dang lam la 'jug ste mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'bad pas bskyed pa'i rim pa brtan zhing zhal mthong ba dang / snang rtags thams cad sgyu mar myong ba dang / ngo bo ma skyes pa'i chos la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas mthong ba dag nas sa dang lam la 'jug ste mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By striving in those, the stage of generation is stabilized, the face is seen, all the signs of appearance are experienced as illusion, and having attained the patience of the unborn nature in the unborn nature, the pure vision enters the paths and stages and will reach the end.

original: da ni gsum pa las kyi tshogs kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas 'gro ba ma dad pa dad par bya ba dang / dad pa phyir mi ldog par bya ba dang / skye bo ngan pa bstan pa la sdang ba tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir phan gdags par tshar gcad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gsum pa las kyi tshogs kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas 'gro ba ma dad pa dad par bya ba dang / dad pa phyir mi ldog par bya ba dang / skye bo ngan pa bstan pa la sdang ba tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir phan gdags par tshar gcad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the third, in order to make faith arise in those who do not have faith in the Buddha and Bodhisattva conduct of the accumulation of karma, and in order to make faith irreversible, and in order to destroy the evil people who are hostile to the teaching, one should benefit and destroy.

original: rgyal ba'i bka' dang bla ma'i gdams ngag gi rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bka' dang bla ma'i gdams ngag gi rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: Following the Victorious One's words and the guru's instructions,

original: snod dang mi mtshungs pa rnams la bstan pa na rang ngan song du 'gro ste /
analyzed: snod dang mi mtshungs pa rnams la bstan pa na rang ngan song du 'gro ste /
translated: when one teaches those who are not suitable vessels, one goes to the lower realms oneself.

original: sngon gyi pandi ta rnams song ba'i gtam rgyud las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi pandi ta rnams song ba'i gtam rgyud las shes par bya'o //
translated: This can be understood from the stories of the past panditas.

original: mtshams med pa byed pa'i skye bo @110b bla ma dang chos kyi bar chad byed pa de /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa'i skye bo @110b bla ma dang chos kyi bar chad byed pa de /
translated: The person who commits the five heinous acts and creates obstacles for the guru and the teaching,

original: kha sbyor dbye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: kha sbyor dbye bar 'dod na /
translated: if one wishes to separate them,

original: bdag rje btsun ma'i bskyed rim brtan pa dang / thugs ka'i 'khor lo 'bum tsho drug 'thon pas de shes rab dang ni dus kyi gnad dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: bdag rje btsun ma'i bskyed rim brtan pa dang / thugs ka'i 'khor lo 'bum tsho drug 'thon pas de shes rab dang ni dus kyi gnad dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: One’s own stable generation stage of the Venerable Lady and the six hundred thousand wheels at the heart are the knowledge and the time.

original: rje btsun ma 'byung ba lnga'i lha mo des yang me lha gtam gyi ngo bor rgyu ba na khro mo chen mo'i dbyibs kyis 'od kyi gri gug gis snying nas dral /
analyzed: rje btsun ma 'byung ba lnga'i lha mo des yang me lha gtam gyi ngo bor rgyu ba na khro mo chen mo'i dbyibs kyis 'od kyi gri gug gis snying nas dral /
translated: The Venerable Lady, the goddess of the five elements, when moving in the nature of the fire god, with the form of a great wrathful woman, with a knife of light, cuts from the heart.

original: sngags la che ge mo aa mu kam m'a ra zhes pa ni gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngags la che ge mo aa mu kam m'a ra zhes pa ni gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: The mantra is “Kill such and such, so and so.”

original: bkug ste ka p'a lar bcug ste /
analyzed: bkug ste ka p'a lar bcug ste /
translated: Having summoned, one puts into the skull cup.

original: ral gris gtu bsal kho'i srog rlung gi don snying lnga srog rtsa nas drangs nas /
analyzed: ral gris gtu bsal kho'i srog rlung gi don snying lnga srog rtsa nas drangs nas /
translated: With the knife, one cuts the five vital wind-heart essences from the life channel.

original: khro mo'i zhal du gsol te /
analyzed: khro mo'i zhal du gsol te /
translated: One offers them to the mouth of the wrathful woman.

original: sha zos khrag rngubs rus pa 'chos /
analyzed: sha zos khrag rngubs rus pa 'chos /
translated: One eats the flesh, drinks the blood, and chews the bones.

original: shes pa rlung la bstims pa te lha mo'i thugs nam mkha' stong par phyal gyis gtong ste /
analyzed: shes pa rlung la bstims pa te lha mo'i thugs nam mkha' stong par phyal gyis gtong ste /
translated: One dissolves the consciousness into the wind and totally releases it into the empty sky of the goddess’s mind.

original: nam phyed na brgya'am stong du bya /
analyzed: nam phyed na brgya'am stong du bya /
translated: At midnight, one should do it one hundred or one thousand times.

original: nyin phyed dang tho rangs su byas na bsgrub bya lus sems kha sbyar phyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin phyed dang tho rangs su byas na bsgrub bya lus sems kha sbyar phyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does this at noon and at dawn, one will accomplish the union of body and mind.

original: da ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga sde bza' ba dang btung ba dang / dri zhim pa dang / gos dang / yul dang / mi yid du 'ong ba dang / dgra thams cad dbang du rang ji lta bar bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga sde bza' ba dang btung ba dang / dri zhim pa dang / gos dang / yul dang / mi yid du 'ong ba dang / dgra thams cad dbang du rang ji lta bar bsgrub pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish the subjugation of all enemies, just as one wishes, of the five sense objects—food and drink, sweet scents, clothes, objects, and attractive people—

original: yid bzhin nor rnyed pa lta bu ste /🔽rnal 'byor pa chos kyi bar chad 'tsho bas mi 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: yid bzhin nor rnyed pa lta bu ste / rnal 'byor pa chos kyi bar chad 'tsho bas mi 'byung ba ni /
translated: one will obtain a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: sngar bstan pa lta bu thugs ka nas nyi zla'i steng na 'od zer lnga'i 'khor lo gnas pa las /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa lta bu thugs ka nas nyi zla'i steng na 'od zer lnga'i 'khor lo gnas pa las /
translated: The yogī who is free from the obstacles of livelihood, as previously explained, should visualize a five-colored light wheel on the sun and moon at the heart.

original: 'od zer lnga 'phros te rang gar 'dod pa'i rang gi ka p'a la dum bu gcig pa mdzes shing rgya che ba'i nang du 'ong bar bsams te /
analyzed: 'od zer lnga 'phros te rang gar 'dod pa'i rang gi ka p'a la dum bu gcig pa mdzes shing rgya che ba'i nang du 'ong bar bsams te /
translated: From that, five-colored light rays emanate and enter into one’s skull, which is beautiful and vast, with a single piece.

original: thams cad rang gis siddhi h'um zhes 'ongs par bsam pa tsam gyis rgyal po'i bsod nams tsam yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang gis siddhi h'um zhes 'ongs par bsam pa tsam gyis rgyal po'i bsod nams tsam yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thinking “All of that comes to me through siddhi hūṃ,” merely by thinking that, one will obtain the merit of a king.

original: de bas na yid du 'ong ba thams cad la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na yid du 'ong ba thams cad la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, “all that is pleasing.”

original: de gang gis 'grub na lha gsal ba dang / ngag brtan pas te bzlas pas 'grub pa dang / dus kyi gnad la ngal so nus pa nges so //
analyzed: de gang gis 'grub na lha gsal ba dang / ngag brtan pas te bzlas pas 'grub pa dang / dus kyi gnad la ngal so nus pa nges so //
translated: If one asks by what is that accomplished, it is accomplished by the clarity of the deity and the stability of speech, by recitation and by the ability to rest in the key point of time.

original: da ni rnal 'byor ba 'jigs pa chen po brgyad dang / mi rgod ma rungs pa bcing zhing bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor ba 'jigs pa chen po brgyad dang / mi rgod ma rungs pa bcing zhing bzlog par bya ste /
translated: Now, the yogī should bind and avert the eight great fears and the fierce robbers.

original: dben par bag yangs su rgyu ba ni /
analyzed: dben par bag yangs su rgyu ba ni /
translated: Wandering freely in solitude,

original: bdag gang yang rung ba'i lam du rgyu ba'i dus su gom pa 'bor khar rje btsun sgrol ma yid la dran par wal gyis bya ba dang / g-yas pa'i rogs po spangs la /
analyzed: bdag gang yang rung ba'i lam du rgyu ba'i dus su gom pa 'bor khar rje btsun sgrol ma yid la dran par wal gyis bya ba dang / g-yas pa'i rogs po spangs la /
translated: when the time comes to travel on any path, at the moment of taking a step, one should vividly recall Venerable Tārā and abandon the right side.

original: de ma yin pa'i rogs kyi thad @111a * //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rogs kyi thad @111a * //
translated: In front of the left side,

original: kar ; spyi gtsug autpala'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: kar ; spyi gtsug autpala'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: bind the uḍḍiyāna mudrā at the crown of the head.

original: yi dam gyi gsol ba gdab /
analyzed: yi dam gyi gsol ba gdab /
translated: Make supplications to the pledged deity.

original: gos kyi gsham gyi sna la nang gi yi ge pam las padma'i steng du t'am ljang sngon bsams la /
analyzed: gos kyi gsham gyi sna la nang gi yi ge pam las padma'i steng du t'am ljang sngon bsams la /
translated: On the tip of the hem of the garment, imagine a blue tāṃ on a lotus from the inner syllable paṃ.

original: de'i 'od kyis 'jigs pa brgyad gang 'od du nye ba de gos de'i gos khud du hri la gyis dril la /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis 'jigs pa brgyad gang 'od du nye ba de gos de'i gos khud du hri la gyis dril la /
translated: The light of that [syllable] causes the eight fears to be rolled up into a ball and drawn into the folds of that cloth.

original: rgyu ba gnyis ka bcad la /
analyzed: rgyu ba gnyis ka bcad la /
translated: Having cut off both the upper and lower movement,

original: bsgrub bya mtshams tshun chad phyag mtshan rus phreng gis bcad de 'gul mi shes par byas nas lam gyi sa tshums cig gtums la sngags bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod de //
analyzed: bsgrub bya mtshams tshun chad phyag mtshan rus phreng gis bcad de 'gul mi shes par byas nas lam gyi sa tshums cig gtums la sngags bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod de //
translated: one should bind the path with the mudrā of the bone rosary, which cuts off the object of attainment, and having made it unable to move, one should recite the mantra seven or twenty-one times.

original: mdud pa dmar po bcings la sngags aa mu kam b'a sham ma n'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: mdud pa dmar po bcings la sngags aa mu kam b'a sham ma n'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Having tied a red knot, the mantra is: oṃ āḥ amukaṃ vāśamānayama svāhā.

original: rnams re 'jog ma yin par dus gcig tu bya ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: rnams re 'jog ma yin par dus gcig tu bya ba'i man ngag go //
translated: This is the esoteric instruction for doing [the recitation] all at once without separating the [mantra] syllables.

original: 'jigs pa las thar nas mdud pa ma bkrol na sdig pa che'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa las thar nas mdud pa ma bkrol na sdig pa che'o //
translated: If one is freed from fear but does not untie the knot, there is great negativity.

original: rten 'brel de rnams tshad na the tshom med do //
analyzed: rten 'brel de rnams tshad na the tshom med do //
translated: If those dependent originations are complete, there is no doubt.

original: da ni shes rab blo 'phel bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni shes rab blo 'phel bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, one should accomplish the enhancement of wisdom.

original: yang sngar bstan pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yang sngar bstan pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
translated: Again, endowed with the yoga taught previously,

original: chos kyi shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med par bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med par bya ba ni /
translated: in order to be unimpeded with respect to all phenomena that are objects of knowledge,

original: tshes gcig nas bzung nas tsandra rul pa'i bar du bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: tshes gcig nas bzung nas tsandra rul pa'i bar du bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: One should practice from the first day until the moon is full.

original: zhag lngar chu gtsang la sngags btab ste tho rangs dus kyi gnad la sbyar te btung ngo //
analyzed: zhag lngar chu gtsang la sngags btab ste tho rangs dus kyi gnad la sbyar te btung ngo //
translated: For five days one should enchant pure water with the mantra and drink it at the time of the key point of dawn.

original: de nas zhag lngar dkar gsum la btab ste dus gsum du btung ngo //
analyzed: de nas zhag lngar dkar gsum la btab ste dus gsum du btung ngo //
translated: Then for five days one should enchant the three white foods and drink it at the three times.🔽Then for five days one should enchant sour substances that are not spoiled by other things with the mantra and drink it.

original: de nas zhag lngar skyur rtsi gzhan gyis ma 'bags pa la sngags btab la btung ste de'i sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de nas zhag lngar skyur rtsi gzhan gyis ma 'bags pa la sngags btab la btung ste de'i sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra is this:

original: aom pradzny'a pushtim ku ru sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom pradzny'a pushtim ku ru sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ, cause the increase of wisdom, svāhā.

original: zhes mthar rten gyis bzlas te tho rangs 'thungs na 'grub po //
analyzed: zhes mthar rten gyis bzlas te tho rangs 'thungs na 'grub po //
translated: If one drinks it at dawn, one will succeed.

original: nam re la shlo ka sum stong zin no //
analyzed: nam re la shlo ka sum stong zin no //
translated: One will memorize three thousand ślokas per day.🔽If one does not succeed, one should do the service as previously explained.

original: gal te ma grub na yon tan la sogs pa ste sngar bstan pa ltar bsnyen pa grub nas rang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'dod pa thams cad bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: gal te ma grub na yon tan la sogs pa ste sngar bstan pa ltar bsnyen pa grub nas rang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'dod pa thams cad bsgrubs nas /
translated: Once the service is complete, one should accomplish all the desired goals just as one wishes.

original: rten lha mo byin rlabs ldan pa la g-yon pa'i sa dang / me'i dus mchod pa dang gtor mas mnyes par byas la /
analyzed: rten lha mo byin rlabs ldan pa la g-yon pa'i sa dang / me'i dus mchod pa dang gtor mas mnyes par byas la /
translated: One should please the blessed goddess, the basis, with the earth of the left and with offerings and bali at the time of fire worship.

original: bstod pa dang gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: bstod pa dang gsol ba btab ste /
translated: One should praise and supplicate.

original: de ma t'a re ae ka dz'a ti ma ni siddhi hum zhes pas 'grub po //
analyzed: de ma t'a re ae ka dz'a ti ma ni siddhi hum zhes pas 'grub po //
translated: One will be successful with Tadyathā oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.

original: shel chu shel gyi sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shel chu shel gyi sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the union of crystal water and crystal.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba thams cad dbang du bsdu bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba thams cad dbang du bsdu bar 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if one wishes to bring all beings under one's control,

original: sngags 'di mthar rten bya ste /
analyzed: sngags 'di mthar rten bya ste /
translated: one should recite this mantra at the end:

original: na mo bha ga te aushn'i sha sa dha re dha ra na tri ye sv'ah'a /🔽gi wam la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags nas dpral bar thig le byas na gang la @111b bltas pa de dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na mo bha ga te aushn'i sha sa dha re dha ra na tri ye sv'ah'a / gi wam la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags nas dpral bar thig le byas na gang la @111b bltas pa de dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Namo bhagavate uṣṇīṣāya dharadhare tryadhvasamaye svāhā.🔽If one incanates a cowrie one hundred and eight times and makes a bindu on the forehead, whoever one looks at will be pleased.

original: mig rdzas la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags te mig la bskus na gang 'phrad pa de dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig rdzas la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags te mig la bskus na gang 'phrad pa de dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one incanates eye medicine one hundred and eight times and applies it to the eyes, whoever one meets will be pleased.

original: chu khyor gang la sngags lan bdun bzlas te 'thungs na ma bslangs bar zas rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu khyor gang la sngags lan bdun bzlas te 'thungs na ma bslangs bar zas rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one drinks a ladleful of water incanted seven times, one will obtain food without asking.

original: tshogs kyi nang du 'gro na rang gi gos kyi mtha' ma nas lag pa g-yon pas bzung la nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te phyin na tshig btsan zhing bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang du 'gro na rang gi gos kyi mtha' ma nas lag pa g-yon pas bzung la nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te phyin na tshig btsan zhing bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one enters into an assembly, one should hold the end of one's garment with one's left hand, and if one recites [the mantra] twenty-one times, one's words will be authoritative and true.

original: shags 'debs na lan thebs shing mi 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shags 'debs na lan thebs shing mi 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one engages in debate, one will win and not be defeated.

original: lam du 'gro na dus dang sbyar na don thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam du 'gro na dus dang sbyar na don thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one goes on a journey, all one's aims will be accomplished in a timely manner.

original: gzungs ring rtag tu bzlas na bdud dang nag po'i phyogs kyis mi tshugs shing dgra dang bgegs kyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs ring rtag tu bzlas na bdud dang nag po'i phyogs kyis mi tshugs shing dgra dang bgegs kyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one always recites the long dhāraṇī, one will not be harmed by demons and forces of darkness, and one will not be overcome by enemies and obstacles.

original: gzhan yang phan yon dang phan yon gyis nyams su blang ba'i man ngag bla ma dam pa rnams las ji ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan yon dang phan yon gyis nyams su blang ba'i man ngag bla ma dam pa rnams las ji ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should learn from sublime gurus the benefits and the instructions for practice that are based on the benefits.

original: las tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: las tshogs pa'o //
translated: This concludes the collection of activities.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rje nyer bsdus pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rje nyer bsdus pa //
translated: The embodiment of the compassion of all the buddhas,

original: rje btsun sgrol ma dran pas 'dod sgrub ma //
analyzed: rje btsun sgrol ma dran pas 'dod sgrub ma //
translated: the wish-fulfilling Tara, who is accomplished by merely recalling her name.

original: de yi sgrub thabs dka' 'grel man ngag nyams su blang thabs mdzub tshugs 'dis //
analyzed: de yi sgrub thabs dka' 'grel man ngag nyams su blang thabs mdzub tshugs 'dis //
translated: This instruction on the practice of the commentary on the difficult points of its means of achievement, this pointing out,🔽May I, having dispelled darkness, be consecrated for the sake of the world.

original: mun pa bsal nas 'gro ba'i don bkod bdag gis rlob par shog / rje btsun ma sgrol ma'i man ngag me long dangs pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: mun pa bsal nas 'gro ba'i don bkod bdag gis rlob par shog / rje btsun ma sgrol ma'i man ngag me long dangs pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The instruction of the venerable Tārā called the Clear Mirror is complete.

original: // / bems po'i sna rtse dang / 'od kyi dang / dran pa'i dang / dus kyi dang / dbyibs kyi dang / myong ba'i sna rtse'o //
analyzed: // / bems po'i sna rtse dang / 'od kyi dang / dran pa'i dang / dus kyi dang / dbyibs kyi dang / myong ba'i sna rtse'o //
translated: The tip of the dull, the tip of light, the tip of mindfulness, the tip of time, the tip of shape, and the tip of experience.

original: rtag pa'i badzra nas brgyud pa'i dngos grub brtan gzigs kyi rgyud skor 'di /
analyzed: rtag pa'i badzra nas brgyud pa'i dngos grub brtan gzigs kyi rgyud skor 'di /
translated: The siddhi of the lineage of the vajra of permanence, the cycle of the Tantra of Steadfast Vision,

original: rma dang ba ri gnyis kyi lugs //
analyzed: rma dang ba ri gnyis kyi lugs //
translated: The system of both Ma and Bari,

original: dharmm'a k'irti zhes bya bas //
analyzed: dharmm'a k'irti zhes bya bas //
translated: Called Dharma Kirti,

original: dpyal dang bla ma gus ston la //
analyzed: dpyal dang bla ma gus ston la //
translated: To Pyal and Lama Gutoen,

original: zhus pa rin chen lta bu 'di //
analyzed: zhus pa rin chen lta bu 'di //
translated: This jewel-like request

original: sgrol ma'i zhabs la gtugs par smon//
analyzed: sgrol ma'i zhabs la gtugs par smon//
translated: I pray at the feet of Tara.
